New Records: Bobby Witt Jr. drove in his 100th run of the season with a solo homer, setting a new player record for the Royals
Key Match Events: Witt also hit a sacrifice fly in the fifth and a run-scoring double in the sixth
The Royals scored twice in the fifth inning with a triple and a double
The Pirates scored their lone run in the fifth inning on an RBI single
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals were looking to build on their recent winning streak and push towards the postseason
Manager Matt Quatraro emphasized the team's higher goals beyond just a winning record
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Matt Quatraro reflected on the team's progress and goals for the season
Bobby Witt Jr. expressed pride in reaching the 100 RBI milestone
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals secured their seventh win in nine games after a seven-game losing streak
The game marked the Royals' first winning season since 2015
The Royals began the day with a 2.5-game lead in the AL wild card race
Others: The Royals had five stolen bases in the game, with three by Maikol Garcia
The Pirates made three errors behind starting pitcher Mitch Keller
